burn(uint256).details: Burns a specific ERC721 token, and removes the data from our mappings

params.tokenId: uint256 id of the ERC721 token to be burned.
The token id to check for

returns._0: True if approved to redeem/transfer/burn the token, false if not

params.params: Struct containing the tranche and the amount
params.to: The address that should own the position

returns.tokenId: The token ID (auto-incrementing integer across all pools)

params.newPool: The address of the newly created pool

params.interestRedeemed: The incremental amount of interest redeemed
params.principalRedeemed: The incremental amount of principal redeemed (cannot be more than principal deposited)
params.tokenId: The token id to update (must be owned by the pool calling this function)

isApprovedOrOwner(address,uint256).notice: Returns a boolean representing whether the spender is the owner or the approved spender of the token

mint((uint256,uint256),address).notice: Called by pool to create a debt position in a particular tranche and amount

onPoolCreated(address).notice: Called by the GoldfinchFactory to register the pool as a valid pool. Only valid pools can mint/redeem tokens

redeem(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Updates a token to reflect the principal and interest amounts that have been redeemed.

userdoc.notice: PoolTokens is an ERC721 compliant contract, which can represent  junior tranche or senior tranche shares of any of the borrower pools.
